title: Japan-China joint communique
text: In September 1972, the Japan-China Joint Communiqué marked a significant diplomatic shift, as Japan formally recognized the People's Republic of China (PRC) as the sole legitimate government of China, ending its official relations with Taiwan (the Republic of China). This agreement, signed in Beijing, reflected Japan's growing desire for improved diplomatic and economic ties with China. The communiqué also addressed historical tensions, with Japan agreeing to renounce any claims for war reparations from World War II. This shift followed global trends, including the UN's recognition of the PRC and the recent rapprochement between the U.S. and China.
